Builder: John Brown and Company at Clydebank, Scotland
awards:
Battle honours:
Atlantic 1940–41
Pacific 1941–43
Coral Sea 1942
Savo Island 1942
Guadalcanal 1942
New Guinea 1942–44
Leyte Gulf 1944
Lingayen Gulf 1945
Plus two inherited honours
Length:
590 ft (180 m) between perpendiculars
630 ft 4 in (192.13 m) overall
Propulsion:
8 × Yarrow superheated boilers
Curtis high-pressure and Parsons low-pressure geared turbines
80,000 shaft horsepower
4 × 3-bladed propellers
Range:
2,270 nautical miles (4,200 km; 2,610 mi) at 31 knots (57 km/h; 36 mph)
10,000 nautical miles (19,000 km; 12,000 mi) at 11 knots (20 km/h; 13 mph)
Armament:
At launch:
8 × 8-inch (203 mm) guns (4 twin turrets)
4 × 4-inch (102 mm) anti-aircraft guns
4 × 2-pounder (40 mm) pom-poms
16 × .303-inch machine guns
2 × quadruple 21-inch (533 mm) torpedo tube sets
4 × 3-pounder (47 mm) saluting guns
In 1945:
6 × 8-inch guns (3 twin turrets)
8 × 4-inch guns (4 twin mounts)
8 × 40 mm Bofors guns
16 × .303-inch machine guns
4 × 3-pounder saluting guns
Armour:
Magazines and machinery spaces: 1.5 to 3 inches (38 to 76 mm)
Turrets: 2 inches (51 mm)
Conning tower: 3 inches (76 mm)
Anti-torpedo bulges
Belt armour: up to 4.5 inches (110 mm) (installed 1938–39)
